sections.title: IAM Architecture & Policy Alignment
sections.goal: Assess the candidate's understanding of Aegis IAM architecture and how it aligns with company security policies such as POL-SEC-001.
sample_questions: Walk me through the high-level architecture of Aegis IAM and its integration points.
How does the system enforce Least Privilege & JIT Access in practice?
Which components are most critical for maintaining compliance with POL-SEC-001?

sections.title: Threat Modeling & Risk Assessment
sections.goal: Evaluate ability to identify, model, and prioritize threats in IAM context.
sample_questions: Describe your threat modeling process for an SSO + RBAC system.
What are the top three threat vectors for Aegis IAM given its current phase?
How would you detect and mitigate privilege escalation attempts?

sections.title: Incident Response & Runbook Familiarity
sections.goal: Gauge familiarity with operational artifacts like RB-IAM-075 and ability to act under pressure.
sample_questions: Have you used RB-IAM-075 Access Revocation Emergency in a live incident?
What are the key steps from RB-IAM-075 and why are they ordered that way?
How would you adapt the runbook if the incident involved cross-region replication issues?

sections.title: Cross-Project Security Dependencies
sections.goal: Test ability to reason about IAM dependencies on and from other Novereon projects.
sample_questions: How does Aegis IAM interact with Poseidon Networking’s mTLS policies?
What authentication flows are shared between Aegis IAM and Orion Edge Gateway?
If Nimbus Observability detects suspicious login patterns, how should Aegis IAM respond?

sections.title: Trade-offs & Risk-Based Decisions
sections.goal: Understand how candidate makes security trade-offs under constraints.
sample_questions: Describe a situation where you had to choose between strict access control and service availability.
What factors would influence relaxing an SLA to mitigate a security risk?
How do you balance audit completeness (AUD-24-Q2) with operational overhead?
